caption: ChartJS
desc: A prototype loading various chart data into a component (with error handling).

caption: jsPDF
desc: A prototype for creating PDFs using the jsPDF library. Certificates could be generated by entering information manually or in bulk.

images.caption: Fig. 2 PDF created and downloaded screen

caption: Translation
desc: A prototype using ngx-translate to translate a page on-the-fly (versus going to a translated version of the site).

caption: Combo Box
desc: A prototype of a non-styled customizable combo box. Just give the element an ID and pass the data to the combobox function.

caption: Animated Tiles
desc: A prototype used for animated logos. Tiles were randomly selected and animated with a fade out and in effect.

caption: Shop List
desc: Shopsi was a shopping list app for Android devices. You set the minimum quantity threshold, and items whose quantity is equal to or below will have red text color. When items are below the threshold a list icon appears which - when clicked - shows only low in quantity items.

caption: Bucket List
desc: Adelli was a bucket list app for Android devices. Users could create an item and add a picture from their device's photo gallery to to that item. When an item had been completed it was dimmed out and moved outside of the list.

caption: Word Game
desc: Wordoot was a word game for Android devices. It captured both the player's current and best times. The words could be arranged up, down, left, right, diagonal and in reverse order.

caption: Trackball
desc: A game of chance where players had to get the red trackball to land in the trackball cradle. The game was over once a player was successful. It was playable from the desktop.

caption: Email Template
desc: A prototype to help region marketing teams choose and submit an email design copy. PHP was used to handle the request and send email notifications.

caption: Online Approvals
desc: An Online Approval Tool which allowed Project Managers to select team members for a project. Members communicated and were notified via email until the project was closed.

caption: Capacity Graph
desc: Developed for the Creative team, the weekly chart showed the number, type, and "exceeded by" amount of requests. For the data to be entered and stored on the server, a dashboard was also created for Project Managers to enter the value in each week.

caption: Banner
desc: A skyscraper banner whose size could not exceed 10kb. Subsequent banners were dynamically loaded based on user interactivity.

caption: Calculator
desc: A calculator developed to help users determine business cost and savings using Oracle.
